goals.description: By 03/07/2022, when given a set of 5 linear equations with one variable (e.g. 2x + 12 = 5x) with whole numbers, Angel will simplify and solve for the variable with 80% accuracy in 4 out of 5 trials.
goals.baseline: Angel is practicing identifying the operations in an equation and the correct order of steps needed to solve.

goals.description: By 03/07/2022, Angel will be able to independently identify three or more colleges or training programs that lead to his career of interest and the entrance requirements needed for each program.
goals.baseline: Angel has identified that he is interested in working on cars in design and building, but is continuing to identify programs in the area that will support him in achieving this goal.
goals.target: Independently identify three or more colleges or training programs

goals.description: By 03/07/2022, when presented with a blank job application form, Angel will be able to independently complete all portions of a job application with no more than 3 errors in 3 consecutive trials.
goals.baseline: Angel is able to complete about 30% of a blank job application with support from a teacher.
goals.target: Complete job application with no more than 3 errors in 3 consecutive trials

goals.description: By 03/07/2022, with coaching and counseling support, Angel will manage his thoughts and behaviors by reflecting on possible outcomes of his actions. He will utilize coping strategies (movement break, deep breathing, music break, deep pressure/heavy work activity, etc.) to self manage and avoid engaging in unwanted/dangerous behaviors with 4 out of 5 opportunities as measured by mental health clinician and teacher observations.
goals.baseline: Angel reports that he engages in certain behaviors that are potentially dangerous without thinking sometimes and that he knows, and would like, to change this behavior to be more safe.

presentLevels.academic: Angel is currently in 10th grade at KIPP San Jose Collegiate and participates in the Specialized Teaching Program (STP). He has shown significant difficulties in reading, including reading aloud, and writing. Angel's score in the BR category read 180 which means he currently reads at grade 1 or below. Angel shows significantly increased comprehension when he hears a text and engages in a verbal discussion about a topic in class. In math, Angel is able to complete problems using basic addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. When asked to complete problems in a pre-algebra or algebra curriculum, Angel tends to utilize avoidance tactics in a larger group or share that he is confused and ask follow up questions in a smaller group or 1-1 setting.
presentLevels.functional: Angel comments on his ability to grill and cook for himself, navigate his community independently, take care of his daily hygiene needs, and keep a clean living space. Angel is able to navigate his computer and phone independently and speaks of enjoying football and other sports.
presentLevels.social: Angel is able to share his wants and needs with his peers and teachers in the online learning environment. Angel does not display significant social-emotional or behavioral concerns in the virtual learning classroom environment. However, in 1-1 sessions Angel has shared that he struggles with making safe choices, surrounding himself with positively influential peers, and that he takes medication for mental health needs.

extractedData.transitionPlan: Upon completion of school I will identify 3 schools or training programs that include my program of interest. Upon completion of school I will obtain a part- or full-time job in a field of my interest. Student participates in the Specialized Teaching Program (STP) to earn a Certificate of Completion through KIPP San Jose Collegiate. Anticipated Completion Date: 6/8/2023
extractedData.behaviorPlan: From 2019-20SY in-person learning: Angel needs prompts to begin, continue, and complete assignments. He often makes sarcastic remarks at the expense of others. When frustrated or angry Angel can become disrespectful to adults and peers. Positive behavior interventions include specific positive praise, token system in which he earns a reward at the end of the week.
extractedData.placementJustification: Angel is in his 10th grade year at KIPP San Jose Collegiate. The team determined that the most appropriate placement for Angel is KIPP San Jose Collegiate high school's Specialized Teaching Program (STP). STP is a Special Day Class with modified curriculum that focuses on functional academics and adaptive skills. This classroom has a low student to teacher ratio and also has a strong vocational and community-based instruction component. Within STP, Angel will participate in meaningful general education classes like lunch, Math Foundations, English Foundations, and Cinema & Media.
teamMembers: Kyle Markwalter (Cinema and Media general education teacher)
extractedData.additionalNotes: Angel was diagnosed with Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD), Combined Type; Interpersonal Problems; and Anxiety Disorder Not Otherwise specified in 2008. An evaluation was conducted by the Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) Center in December 2011 which found that Angel had Chromosome 16p11.2 deletion syndrome. Angel reported that he is involved in a criminal investigation and that he has been diagnosed with either Multiple Personality Disorder or Schizophrenia, for which he takes medication daily.
